data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِي comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.

data.meanings: command/order/enjoin, authority/power/dominion, counselled/advised/consulted, hold/appoint command, preside as a commander/governor/prince/king, experienced, become many/abundant.
data.sentence: The word بِأَمْرِهِ comes from the root ا م ر and is associated with the meanings: command/order/enjoin, authority/power/dominion, counselled/advised/consulted, hold/appoint command, preside as a commander/governor/prince/king, experienced, become many/abundant.

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word لِقَوْمٍ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: to bind, keep back, be intelligent, become wise, understand, pay the blood price for anyone, ascend on the summit of a mountain, use understanding, abstain.
data.sentence: The word يَعْقِلُونَ comes from the root ع ق ل and is associated with the meanings: to bind, keep back, be intelligent, become wise, understand, pay the blood price for anyone, ascend on the summit of a mountain, use understanding, abstain.

data.meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)
data.sentence: The word اللَّيْلَ comes from the root ل ي ل and is associated with the meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)

data.meanings: to be bright with sunshine, be glorious, be sunny. shams - sun.
data.sentence: The word وَالشَّمْسَ comes from the root ش م س and is associated with the meanings: to be bright with sunshine, be glorious, be sunny. shams - sun.

data.meanings: to be white. qamarun - moon (especially from the 3rd to 26th night).
data.sentence: The word وَالْقَمَرَ comes from the root ق م ر and is associated with the meanings: to be white. qamarun - moon (especially from the 3rd to 26th night).

data.meanings: to cause stream to flow, repulse, reproach, flow abundantly, drive back, brow beat, chide, do in the day time, day, daytime, daylight hours (from dawn to dusk).
data.sentence: The word وَالنَّهَارَ comes from the root ن ه ر and is associated with the meanings: to cause stream to flow, repulse, reproach, flow abundantly, drive back, brow beat, chide, do in the day time, day, daytime, daylight hours (from dawn to dusk).

data.meanings: to mock/laugh/scoff at, make fun of, ridicule, look down, deride, taunt, jeer, to compel to work without payment, make subservient, press into service, harness, bring under domination or control, subjugate, constrain anyone to forced work.
data.sentence: The word وَسَخَّرَ comes from the root س خ ر and is associated with the meanings: to mock/laugh/scoff at, make fun of, ridicule, look down, deride, taunt, jeer, to compel to work without payment, make subservient, press into service, harness, bring under domination or control, subjugate, constrain anyone to forced work.
The word وَالنُّجُومُ comes from the root ن ج م and is associated with the meanings: to appear/rise/begin, accomplish, ensue, proceed.
